content.text:
# Presidential Flight (UAE)

| key_people =
| bases = Abu Dhabi International Airport (AUH)
| frequent_flyer =
| lounge =
| alliance =
| fleet_size = 8
| destinations =
| website = http://pf.govu.ae
}}
Presidential Flight (originally known as “Royal Flight”) is the organization responsible for air transport of the government of Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates. It was first established in 1975 under the Private Department of Sheikh Zayed Bin Sultan Al Nahyan.
The airline previously operated under the name Abu Dhabi Amiri Flight and changed its name to Presidential Flight on 16 February 2009.
Fleet
in 2022]]
-600R of the Presidential Flight at Perth Airport, Australia, in 1990s.]]
